poem.title: Arcadia
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Bucolic yes idyllic no They all lambed at once Honed on winter wind, the pack Was onto them like 'land ahoy!' With fire, a drystane fold and a squad Of berserk dogs in place, the shepherd lad. Below, a cellar's stocked, a boiler lagged For a lard and worsted corporation.
